reviews.text: We visited Melia with our 3 kids (16, 9 & 5) and our friends and their 2 kids (11 & 7), after having stayed at Paradisus Punta Cana with just us two couples the year before. We got family jr. suites , which are right by the beach and pool. You cannot go wrong if you end up in buildings 1-3. We were supposed to have buckets and pails waiting in the room as a welcome gift for the kids as part of the family suite booking, but neither our kids or our friends got them after a few calls and promises that they would be sent. There was also a scheduled kid gift/activity scheduled in the children's area that we showed up for, but no one was there. While I never use childcare, our kids did get to sit in on a magic show they had, and I did see the caregivers taking the kids all around the property for lunch, feeding the peacocks, swimming etal. My age ranges were pretty well engaged with the things offered on property as well, but be forewarned you will have to pay for some of the key activities they will want to do. The sky ropes course will cost you 10 bucks American, the Euro Bungy another 6 bucks, figure another 6 bucks for the climbing wall, and there is a huge 2 story slide on the beach that will run you 2 bucks for 3 slides, and they will also take the kids horseback riding for 10 bucks. All those extras initially rubbed me the wrong way since I thought EVERYTHING should've been included in a family ALL inclusive, but what are ya gonna do? Just be ready to pony up at least 32 to 50 bucks per kid if you plan to let them do it all - and they will want to! The only included activities they did were the pedal boats and canoes, which were fun and easy to book. Although there were volleyball nets, they wanted my friend to pay for a ball! I must interject here that Paradisus was superior in this area, as they offered everything from the balls to organizing the games, to basketballs, playing cards, books, etc. You also get free horseback riding, scuba lesson and one free scuba dive there along with all your nonmotorized watersports. We just couldn't go there with our family of five like we could at Melia, or else we would have returned or tried Palma Real, their higher end property located right next to Melia.
reviews.title: Great 4 family of five

likes.disliked: — Reservations hassle and extra costs for kids activities

reviews.text: Paradisus has all of its restaurants near the beach, whereas Melia's restaurants are all back at the lobby a good walk away. The trains were regular, but the walk wasn't bad to me. The food quality, variety and quantity was much better at the Paradisus. The buffet at Paradisus had a better selection and was partially indoors so you didn't have the invasion of flies like you had at Melia's outdoor restaurant by the beach. Also, at Paradisus my "hungry man" was able to order two entrees for dinner, which they would not allow at Melia. And good luck on getting your dinner reservations at Melia. The property was barely half full when we were there, but it was a lot of work to get into a restaurant you wanted versus what they had left by just 9:30 am. Maybe those in Royal service didn't have this problem, because they have someone make their reservation and get first dibs, but those rooms are also FAR away from the beach. Remember, the family suites are the BEST - close to beach, spa/gym and pool).
reviews.title: One Time Only and Not Again....
Don't Believe the Bad Ones
reviews.text: As for the nightly shows, take your kids to the Flintstones show and disco they have, but you may not want to take them to the adult shows. They were a bit racy in spots. We brought along a grandma who kept the kids while we went out to the shows and dancing- they have live music in the lobbies and beds you can lay in and tables to sit at. Oh, speaking of racy shows, also be aware that women go topless on the beach, and a few around the pool. At most, however, this drew a "put those things away, there are children here!" from my 11 year old godson - hilarious! Should you leave the kids in- room at night, there are English children's channels and playstation ( I think you have to rent these games, but if you bring your own, and your own controllers, you may not have to bother to pay the resort yet another extra).

reviews.title: Loved Every Minute!
reviews.text: To sum up, the food was so-so, much better at Paradisus. It is a place where a family of five can stay in one room, which is hard to find, and there is a good amount for younger and older kids to do (although the teen nightclub was always empty). Nevertheless, I would recommend Paradisus Punta Cana over Melia if you don't need room for five. No matter what you choose, you absolutely canNOT go wrong with the BEAUTIFUL beach.

The Room...Late check in, only one person at the Front Desk. Room requested was not ready. Gave us another room. The room was dirty and had roaches. Maintenance showed up late afternoon to spray the room. We were always short of towels and one day the housekeeper forgot the toilet tissue too, so we had to call for service. Housekeepers do not vaccumm the rooms, they just sweep and mop. There was hair every where. One day they forgot to turn the room, so we had to call for service again. Each housekeeper carries 16 rooms per day...
reviews.title: Has its good points....
Terrific hotel
reviews.text: after reading reviews I was a little intimidated by the reported size of the resort, but we ended up in rooms close to the beach and pool and the walk to the lobby and restaurants was only about 10 minutes and the grounds are so beautiful the walk was enjoyable. We did have a couple of issues at check in with accessibility for my mother who uses a scooter but they were quickly resolved the next day and they even sent a repair man to help us fix the scooter that had been disabled by Air Transat with no explanation of what they had done...Sergio at the front desk was awesome and we quickly had the room situation fixed early on day two...the rest of the next two weeks was awesome...my husband golfed a couple of times and enjoyed the course and my daughter had a blast at the kids club, and in the pool...we are usually ready to go home after about 10 days, but not here...we ate at the buffet mostly because we were a very large group but never had any problems finding something great to eat...the timeshare folks were a bit annoying but a simple 'no thanks' usually did the trick...overall we had a great stay and may even consider going back to this resort even though we usually like to try new resorts each year...

Great Resort. If this is one of your first trip to a very large resort (like me) don't try to be everywhere every day. Pick a few spots and relax. Food was great lots of restaurants to select. Call early in the morning to makie reservation for next day
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: Royal service is definitely worth it. Great facilities like large suites, internet access, Room service, Gabi restaurant/pool, seems to have priority for restaurant reservations.
reviews.title: We will be back next year!
Total Nightmare
reviews.text: One issue is every one trying to sell you time share. Just ignore them.

Typically we stay away from all inclusive resorts from past experiences...but no more! This place is a must see. The size is big but don't let they stop you because the size actually allows for you to feel like you always have your "own space" The food and service in the A La Carte restaurants was world class as far as we are concerned. Buffets were great and exactly what we wanted for our morning meal and odd afternoon meal. We couldn't get over the evening atmosphere in and around the main HUB of the resort. It was couples just curled up on lovely chairs for two and privacy for everyone. Peacocks and pink flamingos roamed around the gorgeous tropical setting and fish and swans were a plenty in the two many to count manicured ponds scattered everywhere. Rooms were beautiful, linen was superb, and when you retired to your room it was so quiet because all activity was up at the main buildings. The resort is HUGE, so you have to take a train that was constantly moving around the resort but it only took a couple of minutes for you to get picked up anywhere. The only difficulty ( and only slight) was the communication barrier, not alot of staff ( other then the front desks) spoke much english,. however we always managed to get our point across. One important note, make sure you take enough money with you, the ATM (only one) on the resort was out of money until our last day so we had to go across the resort to the Mall and had abit of problems with the language again at the bank. Take U.S. not pecos., they prefer it and it is easier to understand what you are paying. Great time, can't wait to go back next year.
reviews.title: Lie on the size of the beds.
Bavaro Beach - Si!, Melia Caribe Tropical - So So!
reviews.text: We had a great time during our stay at MCT but I've already had a couple of people ask me if I would stay there again, and I would probably try one of the other resorts.

The Good - Bavaro Beach, I've gone to a lot of beaches in the Caribbean but I've never seen one that stretches on forever like Bavaro. Yes there is some grass in the water but it's nothing like Cancun. A great beach for a swim or a long walk and lots of palm trees when you need shade.
reviews.title: Disgusting flies

reviews.text: The MCT grounds are beautifully landscaped and very well maintained. The pools are awesome, even during the busiest times of day it never felt crowded. Lots of shade in and around the pool and all but the last day we were there had a great breeze coming off the beach. We had no problem with mosquitos but there always some in your room. Keep the a/c turned down and the ceiling fan on high.
reviews.title: Melia Caribe-good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was better than what I was expecting after some of the reviews I had read. We ate at the Mexican, Italian, Seafood, and Japanese restaurants. We might have had an appetizer or soup that wasn't up to par but mostly everything was good to very good with one major exception - they don't seem to believe in chocolate! The seafood (Capri) entrees were limited to fish but I had the snapper and it was great. The waitstaff at the restaurants and bars are for the most part great.
reviews.title: Honest review; the good, bad and ugly

reviews.text: The Bad - Check-in, those folks had a seriously bad attitude. Our flight got in early and so I at least hoped we'd be able to check-in early but no - "no check-in before 3:00". Went and got something to eat, came back about 5 minutes until 3:00, "come back in 5 minutes". When I came back in 5 minutes was told "your room is not ready and will be another 30 minutes". Until this point I had tried being as polite and friendly as I know how and had gotten nowhere. I finally had to tell them to give me a room "now", which they did in the same building as the first room. Had to make two trips back to the front desk to get them to activate my room keys to use the safe ($2/day).
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings...

likes.disliked: — Towels, dinner reservations and commuting within the resort.

reviews.title: Loved the Melia Caribe Tropical...
reviews.text: Me and my hunny, just got back from a 1 week stay at the Melia...April 17-24th....We arrived on the 17th and met 2 good friends there, later that night....The check in went very fast and smooth..If you have all your information with you, that you need, like your hotel vocher, you will be fine....After checking in, we found ourselves in the Tropical side....but we requested the Caribe side, to be next to our friends....After seeing this, they upgraded us, to the Caribe side....WITH A JACUZZI.....TO THE HONEYMOON SUITES...We loved it....no charge....We stayed in 36.....the beach was right off our front door and the pool was right next to us too...AWESOME....our maid was excellent....she even left me cold beer a few times and plenty of water and pop....We tipped her a buck or 2 each day, along with a few cheap gifts we brought from home to give out....candies, soaps, deoderants, hair products, Canadian parafanila......almost everything from the dollar store....
I would recomend bringing many $1 bills US, to give out, as tips....and they also help out at the markets.....
reviews.title: Great vacation spot!
LOVED THIS PLACE !
reviews.text: AH...The markets.....They are good, and cheap...but don't let the people presure you...You will find all the people from the Dominican are really friendly.....They will call you...'' My friend "" thats OK, but never feel presured to go buy anything...All you have to say is '' I BE BACK TOMMORROW''' that seemed to work for me, lol....but make sure you barter....NEVER GIVE IN TO THEIR OPENING BID...ITS USUALLY ABOUT 70% OVER FROM WHAT THEY WILL TAKE...For example...I went to the market to buy rum, on my first day there...I asked a man to show me the best rum he had...so he showed me a bottle of Brugal amber rum...he wanted $20 US a bottle...We laughed and needless to say, we brought home 5 bottles, for $25 US...they all have little calculators at the market, and they type in a price and show it to you, then you take the calculator, and type in , what you want to pay.....inbetween...is the real price.....but always go lower and leave....trust me...they will follow you and renegotiate...

reviews.title: stomach pains worth it??
reviews.text: The food was great...We ate at the Japennese, American Grill, Seafood restaurants....the Japenese was awesome to go to, because the chef prepared everything right in front of you...the buffets were awesome too....lunch was was favorite because they served nachos and cheese...check it out, at the Agora buffet..

The drinks were awesome too....A good favorite is a banana mama...a good rum drink...I recomend bringing an insulated mug with you...We brought 2 Bubba keg mugs ( holds 52 oz) and they filled them with anything, we asked....beer, banana mamas, rum, etc...and let me tell you, we could have sold them about 100 times....you can get them at any Canadian Tire for $19.99.....MAKE THE INVESTMENT....ITS WELL WORTH IT...you fill it up, before you go on the beach, and you drink stays cold for like, 3 hours....no joke....
reviews.title: Was afraid to go after reading reviews...we had a great time

reviews.text: Just returned home from the Melia Caribe Tropical April 20th 2011, we had an awesome time as we love Punta Cana so much. I will keep this review short as sometimes reading long reviews becomes boring.
reviews.title: Nice Time In Punta Cana

reviews.text: * The Pros:
reviews.title: I know money talks, but still...

reviews.text: Lovely resort, nice grounds, very clean, easy to get around, all facilities close together, fresh tasting food, great desserts, buffet and a-la-cartes are good, drinks were good, nice lobby sitting areas, rooms were nice, room safe was inexpensive, adequate entertainment on resort, good shopping areas on either side of resort on the beach, lots of security guards, check-out was fast.
reviews.title: Another Great Punta Cana Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *The Cons:
reviews.title: Lower your expectations- the pictures are misleading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was very slow. Pools are too deep- had to hold drink above your head. Disco is too dark- can't see inside. Room had some sand fleas and mossies. Beach and ocean had much seaweed- at no fault of resort. Bar service was hit and miss- sometimes fast, sometimes slow. No bar on the beach. No beer in bar fridge- though this did not bother me. Time share persons bother you for the first two days until they start to recognize you.
reviews.title: pleasant trip
Family of three enjoyed thoroughly
reviews.text: I was lucky enough to spend two fabulous weeks at this resort. I traveled with my husband, two year old son, as well as a few other family. We stayed in the Royal service and were warmly greeted in the royal service lounge. Following check in we were able to help ourselves to a cocktail while the butler loaded our luggage into a golf cart in preparation for the trip to our room. We were pleased with the large size of the room as we were travelling with a toddler who needs a little extra space to play. The room was immaculate. We did not , however, figure out the air conditoner knob did not work until the second week. My husband was able to manually turn the unit on once we figured out the problem. Even without the airconditioner the room was cool enough, just a little damp for my liking. We also thought the shower was broken but after a call to the maintenance man who showed us how to work it, we found there really wasn't a problem.

reviews.title: Paradise
reviews.text: The buffets were good. Not amazing, but we didn't go hungry. Certain items such as sausage and other cured meat taste different from what I am used to but thats the way it is there. We tried all the a la carte resteraunts. Italian was boring. Dominican was surprisingly good with great service. French had great food but the service was horrible and you may or may not acutally get your food. Japanese was good-ish food but the experience of sittiing at the table with travellers from all over was really interesting. My husband and I really liked the chinese but others in our party did not. Mexican and the American were good. The international had very interesting items but they were not well prepared (read: overcooked).

reviews.title: Family/Friends Get Together
reviews.text: For people travelling with young children: there are no cheerios there, and the milk is UHT. I know a couple of people I talked to said there kids would not drink the milk, my kid included. Also do not by diapers at the mall just adjacent to the resort. i spent $20 for 24 pampers. Plaza bavaro and other shopping areas are much cheaper. I did not visit the childcare area but I was told by my beloved mother that there is not too much going on for kids under 4. But all the employees seemed to love children and tried to befriend my son. I never felt awkward taking him into any resteraunt even when he was behaving like the two year old he is. We attended the kiddie disco and enjoyed. My only gripe is that there is no playground area where the kid can play and I can watch.

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: I also want to say that yes the resort is huge and i got lost lots of times. But the resort is beautiful and immaculate. I would eat off the sidewalks it is so clean. The size of the resort was actually beneficial as there is no town nearby. In two weeks we never got bored. We did go one outing to Manatai park. It was fun for children. The bus ride there . . . well the bus had no windows. . .and it rained on the way back . . . while travelling at 70kph! Hold on to your hats and young ones! I lived to tell.

reviews.title: Royal Service Well Worth It
reviews.text: Overall it was a great place the staff were attentive and I was dissappointed I had to leave!

My husband and I decided to stay at this resort even after reading the reviews and staying at another Melia in Los Cabos (which was not so great as well) but we figured that some people just like to complain so lets give it a try. Well this is my opinion:
reviews.title: Not a complainer but this hotel is bad

likes.disliked: — Food, Lack of service, Dirty room

reviews.title: lock up
reviews.text: The Positive things about the Hotel:

reviews.title: Perfect Vacation!
reviews.text: 1. Beach and grounds are beutiful... and the majority of the people working there are out to please you and are very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Negative things.
reviews.title: Melia a huge mega-hotel property

likes.liked: — Our unit was right on the beach. We were upgraded into a junior suite. (Got very Lucky)
likes.disliked: — AC was poor. Safe was additoinal $ per night (We were never charged)

reviews.text: 1. Royal Service is a scam. It was not Royal for us and we are simple travelers. I have a 16 month old son who woke up at 11:00 at night crying, only to find a roach on him. When my husband called the front desk they thought it was a joke untill i took it to the manager in the morning. They just stated that every place has roaches. I understand that but not on my baby and I paid an extra 700.00 dollars to upgrade my room for royal service.
reviews.title: Go, relax and have a great time!!!

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, everything you need available. Great housekeeper!
likes.disliked: — Musty smell but it was humid out. We brought candles for the room.

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Punta Cana at this hotel. It was wonderful for families with young children- the kids enjoyed the kids club and each evening they had a kids disco for family entertainment. The staff was very helpful. I left the cleaning lady a note to leave me more bottled water for the kids and she left me a whole case. The grounds were absolutely amazing and the kids were in awe of all of the wildlife. The timeshare people were a bit insistent but once we made it lcear that we were not interested, they left us alone. The trains on the property though run extended hours and start early in the morning- and I am a light sleeper. The pools were excellent and the beach had a bit of seaweed. I enjoyed the international flavor at this hotel. The swings were very inviting on your walk. The restaurants were delicious (we never had problems obtaining reservations). Would definitely go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

reviews.text: I had some doubts about this resort before we came like so many people do. to anyone that is booked or thinking about booking let this be the only review that u need. this resort is so classy, so well maintained and so beautiful that it literally seems like its fake! ill try and keep it short and simple
reviews.title: EVERYTHING IS HERE FOR YOU!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is BIG BUT its not overwhelming. by day 2 u should have it figured out! it is split into 2 sections. the one on the right is the tropical and the one on the left is the caribe if ur looking at the ocean. in between them up front where u arrive are the restaurants and outdoor chairs,couches and little bars that connect them. really well designed.
reviews.title: One of the best resorts we've been to in the Caribbean!

reviews.text: Staff - UNREAL and so so nice..they all go above and beyond for u the entire time. cant say enough about them!
reviews.title: Amazing family vacation

reviews.text: Restaurants- food is very good, service is great in all of them..mexican and international are the best ones. reservations are made by simply picking up the phone in ur room and dialing a 4 digit number. at that time u can reserve for that night and the next night. call in the morning to get a bigger selection of dinner times. the dinner buffet is excellent so if u want just eat there every night whatever time u want!
reviews.title: Great relaxing vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a one week stay and had a really good time. The people were very friendly, the service was good overall, and the resort grounds are just beautiful (very lush and tropical with flowers, palm trees, ponds, birds, flamingos and peacocks running around). We feel that the all-inclusive gave us a good value…the food was overall satisfying and the alcohol was good quality and never watered-down. In fact…the drinks were sometimes quite strong. The resort is quite large but we never had any problems getting around…there are trains that come through every few minutes to take people around. Or…when we had more energy we just walked and enjoyed the gardens.
reviews.title: We had a blast! Beautiful grounds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LAYOUT: The resort is split into two sections that mirror each other...the Caribe side and the Tropical side (Sol Melia members side). Each side has a buffet restaurant by the beach, a large pool area with pool bar close to the beach, immaculate grounds and a lobby. However, guests seem to be able to go between both sides regardless of which side their room is on. The only section not open to everyone is the Royal Service area. The Royal Service guests pay extra to have nicer rooms, room service, a private pool and restaurant, etc… The Royal Service rooms are the furthest rooms from the beach and are closer to the lobbies, golf course, a la carte restaurants and shopping complex.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort, wonderful people

likes.liked: — the variety of restaurants and entertainment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: There are two buffets by the beach open for breakfast and lunch. The other buffet and 9 a la carte restaurants (a la carte for dinner only) are located around the lobby areas. The buffets have a lot of variety and the food quality is average to above average depending on what you select. The food at the a la carte restaurants is better but the menus are limited. Our favorite was the Japanese Teppanyaki restaurant which is in a quaint Japanese style building complete with bridge. We also liked the Thai, French, and International a la carte restaurants. For breakfast and lunch buffets people can wear casual clothes (t-shirt, shorts, sandals) as long as they are well-covered (we saw a girl get kicked out for trying to come in with a bikini on with no coverup). There is a dress code for dinner. For dinner most men wore collared shirts and dress shorts or slacks and dress sandals or loafers. Most women wore skirts, dresses, or nice outfits. You do have to make a reservation for the a la carte restaurants but as long as you plan ahead you will never have a problem.
reviews.title: Royal Service is the way to go!

reviews.text: ACITIVITIES: There are a ton of activities for adults and kids. On check in we were given a calendar of activities for the week. There is a Flintstones area at the Tropical pool and buffet for kids. On the beach there are non-motorized water sports (like paddle boats) that can be used as part of the all-inclusive. For an extra fee the resort has golf, full-service spas, scuba, excursions out of the resort etc… We never had any problem getting a lounge chair on the beach or by the pool.
reviews.title: Incredibble

reviews.text: ROOM: We booked through RCI (timeshare exchange) and were on the Tropical side in the second building from the beach. We loved the location since it was close to the beach and the scuba shop. Our bathroom was a good size and was all marble. Our room had a king size bed which was very comfortable, a couch and chairs, and a nice patio overlooking the garden (very few rooms if any face the ocean). We also had a server with microwave, blender, sink, dishes, etc… but we never used it and assume it is for timeshare members who do not pay for the all-inclusive and buy groceries on their own. Our only complaint with our room was that our TV was a little snowy. We told them about it but it was not fixed during our stay. RCI members do get a few extra perks like private check-in and use of the Members Only transportation. However, be prepared to be hit up for a timeshare presentation wanting you to become an official Sol Melia member.
reviews.title: Amazing for R&R
Wonderful experience
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a week at Melia Caribe/Tropical. This was our third stay at the resort and look forward to many more. We noticed several changes from our last visit three years ago. Most changes were definite improvements.

reviews.title: Great resort
reviews.text: We both felt that the quality of the food had improved. We had several excellent dinners in the specialty restaurants! The exception was the Italian restaurant which at best was average. In a week’s time, you simply don’t have time to try all 12 restaurants.

reviews.title: Ready to Repeat
reviews.text: We had breakfast and lunch at the restaurants on the beach. These meals are buffet style and offered plenty of variety. One problem was that by the time you selected your food and sat down, it was cold. Note: decaf coffee is Nescafe instant.

As mentioned by others, the grounds are spectacular. There are Flamingos, peacocks, white egrets, and several other birds accented by many types of flowers. Bring your camera! The grounds cover a very large area requiring a tram to transport you from one end of the property (beach) to the other (restaurants). One small complaint is that the tram stop is no longer close to the beach. You do quite a lot of walking while staying here and perhaps should not be first choice for the handicapped.
reviews.title: Nice looking resort, but. . .

reviews.text: The beach is the best that I have found. If you like to walk the beach as we do, it seems to go forever. There is no shortage of chairs on Melia’s portion of the beach and numerous thatched huts and palm trees for shade.
reviews.title: A Great Vacation
A Great Vacation
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Melia Tropical for one week and we had a wonderful time. I read all of the reviews on this site and thought that perhaps I had made a mistake but we certainly were not disappointed. Check in was easier then other resorts that we stayed at and when we asked for a room close to the beach we were easily accomodated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got to the room we found there were no towels so I called to report it and by the time we had gone to grab a bite to eat the towels had been delivered. It would have been nice to have more towels but we made due and it was fine. The room was kept very clean, we did see a small roach in the bathroom on the first night, I am terrified of these things but I had brought some bug spray with me so I sprayed the entire room and we didn't see anything else the entire week.
reviews.title: Will not be going back

reviews.text: The grounds as everyone has commented are absolutely beautiful and well groomed.
reviews.title: Royal Service All the way

likes.disliked: — The lack of variety of foods for all cultures.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is also quite beautiful and very long, great if you like to take long walks on the beach. There is a problem with sea weeds in the water but we found clear patches in the general area that we sat so it didn't really bother us. It is correct that people go early to put their towels down on chairs with shade and don't return for hours but we found that if we got to the beach around 8:00 / 8:30am we were able to get chairs with shade. We also left our towels on the chairs while we had lunch but we would go back right after and we usually stayed on the beach until 5:30pm.
reviews.title: Extraordinary!!!

likes.liked: — geat food, lanscape, beach, basically everything was the best
likes.disliked: — rain: no hot tubs except gender specific ones in spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had lunch at the buffet restauarants, there is one on the beach and one by the pool, we preferred the one by the pool we always found something we liked.
reviews.title: A truly relaxing week

reviews.text: We just returned from 8 days at The Melia Caribe (Aug. 1 - 8).
reviews.title: Above Average Facilities; Below Average Service

likes.liked: — The beach and the manicured gardens
likes.disliked: — Poorly managed staff ... rude, slow, could not communicate

reviews.text: The resort is big, bustling and, in many ways, beautiful. Unfortunately, the service does not remotely match the quality of the facilities. Royal Service is anything but royal -- average would be a better description. We encountered check-in difficulties, maintenance issues, transportation issues, rudeness ... you name it. Be prepared for very slow response times and endless communication struggles (no one speaks English).
reviews.title: The Worst Vacation I Ever Had

likes.disliked: — the lack of service and TERRIBLE food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was extremely nice. Go early in the morning before the sea grass gets all stirred up by the motorized water sports. Good luck trying to hitch a ride from The Royal Service villas to the beach. The golf carts run inconsistently, when they run at all.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Vacation

reviews.text: The food was pretty good. Be sure to visit the Japenese restaurant. It was as good as everyone claimed.
reviews.title: Melia Caribe - a beautiful resort

likes.disliked: — lack of interesting things to do OUSIDE the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a Disney-like experience with big crowds, lush grounds and you have a high tolerance for inefficiencies, you will probably enjoy this resort. It is very family friendly and does offer alot in the way of tropical beauty. As for our family, we do not plan to return. Just too many frustrations.
reviews.title: I would not return here!!

reviews.title: Best holiday ever.
reviews.text: Holmfirth,Yorkshire,England

reviews.title: love it
reviews.text: 19th April 2006

reviews.title: DO NOT STAY AT THE MELIA TROPICAL
reviews.text: We travelled with First choice to the resort of Punta Cana and had an excellent holiday. We had not been to the Dominican Republic before, but would definatley return. The people, food and service, was excellent. We stayed at the hotel Melia Caribe, and on arrival upgraded to the Royal Service which was fab. The only problem that we found was that you needed to book early in the restaurants to get a reservation. The Chinese restaurant is one to avoid, the best was the American Diner, and although we would have loved to go to the Japanese, we could not get reservations. David at the pool bar cooks excellent hot dogs and burgers, ideal for children at lunch time. The beach restaurants buffetts are great for lunch, all you can eat. The people are very, very freindly and make your stay fun. We will definatley stay at the resort again.

reviews.title: Nice Place... Worst Service Ever !!
reviews.text: wonderfull holidays !!!!

reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Resort!
reviews.text: very nice resort!!!!!

We travelled April 11 - April 18. Upon arrival we knew that we wanted to upgrade. We signed up for the MAS rewards card free online before arrival which provides you late check, 25% off upgrading and other perks. We really wanted the late check out as our flight was not departing until 10pm and checkout is noon. Late checkout gave us until 2.
reviews.title: Amazing family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to upgrade to the master suite and the royal service. The master suite gives you a ktichen, dinning room, living and separate bedroom and bathroom and washroom. This is exactly what we needed with two small children. Allowed us to hang out while the kids slept without having to sit in the dark. Our fridge was restocked twice daily. The Royal service was worth it to us as it gave us access to private pool and restaurant that were just steps from our room. We were also able to access the free wifi from our balcony.
reviews.title: Top of our List

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gabi (private) restaurant offers buffet in the morning and then buffet and a la carte for lunch and dinner. There is also the snack bar right there as well and you did not have to make reservations for this restaurant. I had lobster one night and steak other nights. We also ordered room service when the kids just couldn't make it out for dinner. They were wiped after playing in the water all day.
reviews.title: It was a nice place.

reviews.text: The private beach was nice as well as even when we showed up at 1 or 2 in the afternoon there were chairs available under palapas and the private bar and server service was great.
reviews.title: First time on vacation and they made it worth every penny!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So many people complain about the sea weed but common people it's the ocean, if you don't expect a few fish and sea weed than use the swimming pools. The sea weed was not the long stuff growing on the bottom it just these little grass like pieces floating on the surface.
reviews.title: All in all, a great stay!

reviews.text: Just got back from a 7 day vacation at Meliá Caribe Tropical, and my overall conclusion is the following: beautiful massive site, nice and spacious rooms, service and food in some restaurants needs improving big time.
reviews.title: Could be better
Melia is the best!!
reviews.text: Improving service is complicated in a country like D. Republic, so its up to you, if you pay good tips you'll receive best in class attention, if you don't pay tips you'll be ignored as if you were a 2 star hotel customer.

reviews.title: ignore the bad reviews!!
reviews.text: Don't go the Japanese, Mexican or International restaurants, the food is absolutely disgusting. The positive side is that the best food is served at the beach in the Turey buffet which was a nice surprise.

reviews.title: Beautiful place, nice people, bad food!
reviews.text: The golf course is very challenging but good quality, however during my stay it was too dry and too noisy as they are building villas around the course. It's a nice place but not somewhere I'd pay to go back to. If you're single and looking for fun go somwhere else, this place is for relaxing not partying. Go to the Barceló resort just down the road, it seems to have a younger crowd.

reviews.title: if you like large cockroaches in your room
reviews.text: IMPORTANT: BEWARE FROM THE VACATION CLUB TOUR, ITS WASTE OF TIME TO GET YOU TO PAY 3K$ DOLLARS.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here the first week in June '07. We decided not to do the Royal Service option, but had family staying there at the same time who did, so we got a clear sense of the differences. If we had to do it again we would have payed the extra money for Royal Service. Not so much for the butler service and pillow menu, but for the much less crowded, nicer pool, the additional restaurant, a nicer room, premium liquor at the Royal Service bar, and better chairs at the beach.... beach chair drink service also would have been pretty nice! The on demand golf cart service also would have come in handy because this resort is BIG! The only negative that we could see with the Royal Service is that these are the rooms farthest away from the beach... although a golf cart will take you there whenever you request.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

likes.disliked: — 2 double beds instead of a King

reviews.title: Not the best - not the worst
reviews.text: A few negatives...

We asked for a King size bed and got a room with two double beds (not full size... but double... a little bigger than a twin). We asked to move, but it was not possible the first night , and once we were settled we opted to stay put. The room was very nice though.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is very spread out. There is a shuttle service that runs around the resprt. But it always seemed to be going the opposit direction as us, and the golf carts are sort of like cabs in NYC... hail one down as it is going by if no one else is in it. HOWEVER, given the all-inclusive meals and drinks, we probably managed not to gain weight on the vacation because we walked everywhere, so this negative turned into a positive!
reviews.title: Loved it!! Fabulous Vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sol Melia Vacation Club is a sort of a time-share run by the people who own the Melia Caribe Tropical. We were talked into doing the 90-minute vacation club presentation with the promise that it would really only take 30 minutes, and we would get gift certificates for a free massage at the spa. Be warned... this presentation WILL take the full 90-minutes. Ours actually took 2 hours. Some of the information was interesting, but it took us making it VERY clear that we were done and wanted to leave to get them to stop trying to get us to buy something then and there. We did get our free spa treatments though.... very nice! Just be aware that it will take the full 90 minutes (if not longer), and that they will give you the hard sell.
reviews.title: You get your money's worth and then some!!!
Absolutely Beautiful
reviews.text: Please don't listen to the negative! Me and my husband just returned from 5 days at the Melia. After reading some reviews before we left i was a little weary of going. After arriving we soon began to wonder how anyone thought negative of this place. Check in was alittle slow, but there was so much to offer while you waited for your room. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the resort grounds are extrodinary! We have been several places fron Hawaii to St. Thomas to many other carribean places and this by far was the most beautiful. I am a very picky eater so i was afraid i would not find anything i would like to eat, but there was quite a variety and it was good, some people forget they we as americans are spoiled in the way we cook our food, but they do a good job. I read reviews about bugs in rooms and at the buffets, we did not encounter a single one.

The staff were nothing but polite and very courteous. I think alot of people forget that you get treated the same way you treat others. if you are friendly and not demanding then they are friendly, but who isn't.
reviews.title: Staff are Great!

reviews.text: We were absolutley astounded by how many people never tipped their serevers or bartenders or maids i guess we are just accustomed to tipping for a service even though this is an all inclusive resort they still deserve to get tipped as would any waitress in the U.S. and to them 1.00 is alot they are so greatful for that.
reviews.title: An Excellent Resort. We would definately go back.
what a mess!
reviews.text: We cant wait to go back with our boys! I would highly recommend this place to anyone (and have to several of friends and patients of mine).

reviews.title: beatuful resort with honest review
reviews.text: If you decide to go you definitley have to have a Mojito at the tropical lobby bar and tell Amaury hi! He will be one of the nicest people you meet there.

I found TripAdvisor so helpful that I wanted to return the favor and write a review even though much of what I will say is repetitive. Primarily I wanted to assure everyone that my family's experience was great and that we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Melia Caribe Tropical.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

reviews.text: I, too, read the reviews and was really nervous but we had a great experience. Part of the benefit of TripAdvisor was going in with our eyes open as to the problems, how to get around them, etc. So we knew what to expect.
reviews.title: It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't good either

likes.disliked: — My bed was broken, getting around is a bit confusing, food was bad

reviews.title: Depressed in NJ, having Punta Cana withdrawal
reviews.text: The positives - beautiful grounds, friendly staff, overall good food although the beach buffets lose their appeal after the first day or two - food sitting out in the hot weather, flies, etc. The pools were also excellent. Even though we were closer to the Caribe pool we enjoyed the Tropical more. The kids club was good and my 5 year old enjoyed himself enough to go 2 days. Even though my son does not speak spanish, the staff spoke decent english and I found that kids in his age group find ways to communicate regardless of language. SUrprisingly, we also had decent luck with the bugs. I usually am the one who gets eaten alive when no one else does but I got bit only once and my son and husband didn't appear to be bitten at all.

Many of the negatives that people have pointed out are true - reservations are a pain although my family (only 3 of us and that makes a difference) walked up to at least 2 of the restaurants and were allowed to eat there without a prior reservation. People cancel and it helps to just go with the flow. We did not, however, succeed in getting in to the Japanese restaurant. The facility is huge but I didn't find this to be a negative. The train service was never a big delay and even when you did wait, you could usually convince someone in a bus or golf cart to take you where you wanted to go. We did have problems with our plumbing that I suspect come from water pressure when everyone is using the shower at the same time of day - i.e., around 5-7 when people are getting ready for dinner. WE also had a few bugs but honestly it's the carribean. ALso, there is seaweed on the beach but it's not the long, tentacle-like kind but the short, stick-like variety. This didn't prove to be a problem for us or our 5 year old.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds and beach but.......

likes.liked: — Beautiful beach and many wonderful guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Advice - Bring about $150 in ones (we were there for a week), check out alternatives to the buffet ( a new one opened our last day there that was located where the a la carte restaurants were located and it didn't require reservations - open for breakfast and dinner) and bring an open mind and a relaxing attitude.
reviews.title: A fantastic vacation!!! Would definately recommend to others
GO! Forget the negatives.
reviews.text: My wife and I (both 45) spent a week here starting Jan 12. In a nutshell, we were concerned about the negativity in some of these reviews. We went anyway, and it was the best vacation we have taken. Rooms are perfect, altho we were as far from the beach as you can be. No big deal, we could use the excersize. Grounds are beyond description. Food is good. Not great, but this is DR and there was almost too much to choose from. Be careful booking water sports, the sometimes dont tell you the whole story. Pool side massage started every day for us. Drinks flow freely. Note here that there are 2 different wines served at dinner, be sure to request the Chilean wines over the Spanish. And do not even look at the tap water. I lost a day by rinsing my toothbrush under the tap. Tips are included, but a little extra goes a long way in DR. Have fun, relax, you are on vacation.

reviews.title: first timer loved it
reviews.text: First time to the carribean. My wife set up the trip. I am not a big sun and beach guy. Woke up the first morning sun shining in looked out saw the beautiful grounds and the ocean. Went down to the beach. Incredible white sand and clear turquoise water. I was hooked. Food drinks and service were all excellent. Saw a couple of the nightly shows. They were a little cheesy more audience participation than show. But a lot of audience seemed to be having fun. Beaches are topless and seems to be a lot of europeans. this makes the whole scene very interesting. Bartering with the souvenir people on the beach was a lot of fun. The place is really big so if you don't like to walk plan on waiting for the trains that will haul you around. Better yet walk and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Oh yeah great pools.

reviews.title: also gringas issue
reviews.text: just read a review about the soup, and the issue of stealing from rooms, and remembered this:

reviews.title: I loved it!
reviews.text: one morning we went back to our room early, and one of the working men from the resort called up to a maid " her name" gringas then she came out of the room next to ours and said gracias "his name" and I wondered why was he warning her that we were approaching, didn't sound to good to me. also went thru similiar wait at the morning buffet to get a coffee to go, all I got was "uno momento" took an hour to get that coffee for my husband. The servers were all in the back talking, and there were many guests wandering around with coffee cups looking for a cup of coffee.

reviews.title: Loved This Place! Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: I just returned from Melia Tropical yesterday and it was the greatest vacation ever. The beautiful clean beach with the clear blue-green waters, plenty of lounge chairs, fun activities every day, the whole day, from water aerobics and volleyball to merengue lessons right on the beach. oooh, the drinks and the food. The quality of food was not always good, but if you didn't like one thing, you could always get something else that pleases you. The seafood restaurant "Capri" , the international "Le Gourmet" and the Italian "Gondola" were our favorites as far as ala-carte service went, and the best buffet was hands down the Mexican place "Los Ponchos".

reviews.title: Second time, even better!
reviews.text: We returned, after being wowed in April 2005. We became vacation club members at that time. We brought another couple with us this time. In the interim from our previous stay, the Royal Suites were built, The Gabi Restaurant and pool, and the private beach, and the American Cafe and bar were reopened (there was a fire 2 yrs ago). Best bar: Avenue Bar.

I wrote a review last time. I will say this ONCE AGAIN: If you are people who think the whole world should look, eat and speak like you, stay in America. This is an international place, where flights come from Europe, and the language spoken in the DR is Spanish. We had a blast trying to communicate and learn Spanish with the staff, who was nothing but professional and friendly. When we saw a few people being rude to the staff, we went out of our way to joke around with them and cheer them up. OK, so about Sol Melia: The rooms were great, the staff superb. Unfortunately we were given a butler who got the job because he's pretty or he knows some one, but not because he's a good worker. He was the ONLY one who did not do his job. Everyone else did his job for him. His name is Francisco. Showed up at the end for a tip after another butler had carried down our bags - HA! Adios, Francisco!
reviews.title: Nice family vacation

reviews.text: Our friend had her birthday while we were there. I made a sign at home that said "please say happy birthday to my friend" in spanish. (Por favor deseele Felize Cumpleanos mi Amiga) Well this sign had them bringing us champagne on the beach, happy birthday wishes all over the place, and at the Japanese restaurant that night, they dimmed the lights, and came out banging chafing dish lids, with a birthday cake, singing Happy Birthday, with the balloons I gave them in the afternoon. They were amazing.
reviews.title: The Camp a nightmare

likes.liked: — royal service only way to go

reviews.text: We got perfect drink orders every time. I discovered their rum last time we went, (no Mount Gay). Brugal & Tonics with lime, yummy! Our friends tried dirty martinis, bloody mary, pina coladas. Oh and the cold beer - Presidente. We had great breakfasts, and went to the main buffet - LOS ATABALES -Don't Miss This!!! Both visits we enjoyed going there, even more than the theme restaurants. What a great staff. Once again, if you eat pizza a lot and go to fast food restaurants, and think Outback is good, you'll be whining about the food. If you love to try new things and know good food, you will be happy. We have great Japanese restaurants at home, so Hibachi is tourist food to us. Our friends liked the ones we went to which were Hokkaido (Japanese), Ma Maison (French) and Capri (Seafood). They go a great job, don't get me wrong, but when in Rome...! Almost forgot - the cappaccino is to die for. We became addicted.
reviews.title: Good but not great, full review

likes.disliked: — little english spoken, very limited activities

reviews.title: Winnipers Love Melia Caribe Tropical
reviews.text: The landscaping is over the top gorgeous, the beach is beautiful, and crabbing about the little bit of seaweed which they rake up every dawn so you never see it on the beach is just lame. We have been to many islands, and all this beach needs is bigger waves. The sand is silky smooth clean, the water perfect.

Airport: Expect to walk out of the plane and onto the runway strip. Once you walk into the airport there are people that will stop you to take a picture. You can purchase these pictures at the end of your stay in DR upon departure. You HAVE to pay $10 for entering DR. The line is very long for customs. We had a rude pickup transportation driver. This was the beginning of our bad trip...
reviews.title: relaxing and sunny, but will not go back, rude staff!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The royal service breakfast, lunch, pool and beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving Melia, at check in there is a little posting with prices of upgrade for royal service and regular room rates. My friend and I decided to upgrade and skip all excursions. Upgrading is well worth the money for an extra $30/night. We were told that they'll be a butler driving us to our restaurant every night and to the beach. The only service we got was housekeeping and Benjamin driving us back and forth whenever we saw him at the beach. Housekeeping and Benjamin was the best service we received at Melia besides the waiter at the French restaurant because we tipped the guy!!
reviews.title: Relaxing and fun

reviews.text: Restaurant: Hokkaido was good, it is a Japanese hibachi grill restaurant but on my first night at Melia the clock in our room was slow by an hr, without realizing this, the host at Hokkaido was not willing to accommodate my friend and i because she said we were late for our reservations and she was very rude. I mentioned this to the VIP Royal service desk and they were not nice about it. She just brushed us off!!! We were forced to go to Gabi restaurant at the Royal service and was bitten up with lots of mosquito bites!! The American Grill was good and so was the French restaurant. We didnt get a chance to try any other restaurants on the property.
reviews.title: A fabulous weddingmoon

likes.liked: — Royal Service rooms were great - catered to your every whim

reviews.text: The lunch at the Royal Service side was by far much better than the Tropical buffet.
reviews.title: Great Way to Relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool: There's always available lounge chairs at the Royal service pool area and never crowded in the pool. We did get a chance to walk over to the other pool. It's much larger with more people around the pool. Bring lots of sunscreen.
reviews.title: Awful!

reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from an outstanding week at Melia Caribe Tropical's Royal Service. This was our first stay at an all-inclusive resort and we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great Experience in Royal Service

reviews.text: I am a very well traveled individual and have stayed at upscale (4&5 star) properties throughout the world. By comparison, I would put this Melia at 4-4.5 stars (RS area would fall into 5 star for the D.R.). The Royal Service area was right on par with most other hotel chains who offer a VIP service. The RS lounge was very nice and the staff was very helpful. Our room exceeded expectations (RS Deluxe Jacuzzi Suite) and the hotel grounds were spectacular. The jacuzzi tub was nicer and even nicer when we had the bulter service come prepare the bath. The RS pool area was very nice as was the Gabi club restaurant and bar area. The RS beach area is roped off from the general population and the beach butler was constantly making rounds to refresh your drinks. The beach was great and the water was fantastic.
reviews.title: WOW what a nice to play for a week
good times
reviews.text: As one can see there are a lot of negative reviews for this hotel; however we did not experience the problems mentioned. My wife and I both got really sick on our last night there, but that is the chance you take no matter where you travel outside the U.S., Canada, or Western Europe. I can honestly say that we did not encounter one unfriendly staff member during our whole trip. Every employee at the hotel tries very hard to meet your requests. The only complaint we heard was from a gentlemen I played golf with who said it took 2 hours to get pillows for his children’s beds. Any one going to the D.R. should know ahead, the Dominican people work on "Caribbean" time, which can be slow. However, our dinners were served quickly and glasses were constantly topped off.

reviews.title: Best and Better than Expected
reviews.text: The RS area is definitely more relaxing, more upscale, less crowded, and a lot quieter than the rest of the resort. Since we were in RS we never had trouble making reservations for dinner or golf. The food was much better than expected. I was not expecting outstanding food, but it was really quite good and the chefs put a lot of effort into the dishes and their presentation.

reviews.title: Loved Royal Service and Melia Caribe
reviews.text: I would recommend this resort, especially the Royal Service. The resort is huge, so if you don't like to walk or wait for transportation then select another resort. For us the walks were great (the grounds are immaculate) and there was always transportation after a short wait.

reviews.title: Worst resort I have ever stayed in
reviews.text: This place was hands down the worst resort I have ever stayed. I would never recommend this resort or even Punta Cana to anyone I know. There are three positives of this resort:

reviews.title: believe the bad reviews
reviews.text: 1. The Beach is fabulous...the sand is super soft, the water is calm, and the people watching is priceless.

reviews.title: I loved it...I must get back there
reviews.text: 2. The pool area is large and there is plenty of seating always available.

reviews.title: Some good, some bad
reviews.text: 3. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Maybe they could take a couple of those landscapers and put them behind a desk to help guests instead.

reviews.title: Great time, beautiful place, but poor service
reviews.text: The negatives to highlight a few:

reviews.title: tropical paradise!! excellent place to stay
reviews.text: I was married in the gazebo on July 4th 2006 in this resort. It was wonderful. The service was great. We decided not to pay the extra money to upgrade to the Royal Service and we received excellent service and treatment. Our room was very clean and nice. Yes it is a huge resort but we didn't mind the walking at all. I couldn't imagine wanting to sit and wait for the train to take you 5 or 10 minutes down the road. It was super hot so we spent the majority of our time at the pool enjoying the drinks and cooling off in the water. It was just beautiful!!! My husband and I will go back to this place in the future. The food there is very different than what I'm used to so the only thing I would do differently is bring some snacks. Of course they had snacks available in the gift shops there but it was just a limited selection.
The beach was just gorgeous. It is by far the most beautiful beach I've ever seen!!
reviews.title: honest review of melia caribe tropical
Melia PARADISE!
reviews.text: I miss it terribly and can't wait to go back.
We (husband (writing this), wife, boy 19, girl 18) stayed at Melia Caribe Tropical from July 1st to 8th.
reviews.title: I would go back in a second
Dissapointed in service
reviews.text: This review will be honest, from my perspective of course and hopefully helpful to you if you are thinking about booking this resort or have your plans already made.

We traveled with another couple to celebrate their 40th wedding anniversary and upgraded to Junior Service, which we never received! Upon arrival we were dropped at the main entrance and never told to go the the proper check-in area, our suite door did not lock and someone walk into our room, we had daily problems with our bathroom that required maintance and gave us many sleepless nights, pillows and wash cloths had to be requested daily and the food was terrible. Talks wtih the manager didn't help. Golf was part of our package and the only tee times available were 12 noon or later.
reviews.title: Traveler Beware!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — All the unresolved trouble with our room

reviews.text: I would not recommend this resort to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Overall, a good experience

likes.disliked: — The room we were in needed a facelift, and dinner reservations were a hassle.

reviews.text: Our travel agent has been trying to resolve somes issues with the resort since Dec. 07 and has had no luck. Very poor client service!
reviews.title: Great Time!

likes.disliked: — more hangers in the closet would be nice

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Melia Caribe Tropical with our teenage daughter from June 13, 2008 until June 20th.
reviews.title: Love It!!!

reviews.text: Our room was located on the pool which is a highly recommended location. The pools (2) are large and very nice, with a swim up bars. An easy walk to the beautiful beach and steps from the buffet that is primarily used for breakfast and lunch. The beach is very beautiful and water was warm and calm. White powder sand.
reviews.title: Perfection!

likes.liked: — Just about everything! What a lovely place!
likes.disliked: — My parents had trouble with check in.

reviews.text: We had a generally good stay at the Sol Melia Caribe Resort.
reviews.title: Good resort; hit or miss on rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas of the resort are beautiful and offer everything we wanted in a Caribbean resort. Nice pool, well manicured grounds, expansive lobby areas with ceiling fans gently moving the air, and a well kept, large beach all lived up to the promises made in brochures and on-line.
reviews.title: Bumps along the way but enjoyed- Royal Service was key!

likes.disliked: — Level of service and food varied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food at the resort was good, too. The restaurants seemed well operated and the food was good, but not great…but where in the Caribbean is it truly “great,” anyway. The Market Grill – the buffet restaurant – served notably good food and had a super variety for breakfast and lunch. You’ll end up there for dinner, too, unless you make your dinner reservations well in advance (days, if possible) at the specialty restaurants.
reviews.title: Very nice, but not quite there yet....

likes.liked: — Clean facilities and gounds well-cared for. Friendly staff.
likes.disliked: — Food was bland. Some problems with English being understood.

reviews.text: Rooms and service are the areas where this resort needs some help.
reviews.title: Terrible service, inconsistent food, all-in-all a horrible experience

likes.disliked: — food, service, bad attitude from management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was traveling as part of a group, and several members of my group complained that their rooms were run-down. While my room (2nd floor of building 22) was in good shape with attractive furnishings, operable fixtures and air conditioning, and everything in working order, that wasn’t the case in many of the rooms of our group. Many of my colleagues said that the air conditioning in their rooms could barely keep the room below 80 degrees. Three of the group members had problems with plumbing including leaky fixtures, drips from the bathroom ceiling, and other problems. One member of our group showed us how a part of the ceiling in her room literally fell-in during her first night there. While some of these problems are understandable given the climate and challenges they face there, the overarching problem is that the hotel staff and management refused to move these guests to acceptable guestrooms, and offered no compensation for the troubles. I have stayed at Melia-operated hotels in the past, and have not encountered management responses like those received by my colleagues at this resort.

reviews.text: pictures. They also took pictures on the beach. We booked the horse and carriage ($40 more its worth it). We had a luncheon right after the wedding at 2 then there was a private dinner for my 25 guests at six. It was nice. We did take our Ipod and had portable speakers(we brought from home) connected to it because i think paying a DJ $800 is certaintly not worth it especially because i am sure there not going to play the music you like. Most of my guests booked Royal Service and personally I wouldnt go any other way. The air condition in our room was excellent.Our butler was always on hand and if not we would call the RS receptionist and they would come and pick us up to take us allover the resort. The resort is huge and we liked going to both grills on the beach which is on the other side of the resort.

reviews.text: Could we have walked? probably by why should we we paid for RS service and it was HOT. We hung out with our guests at the RS pool and the Gabi restaurant. We tried several of the restaurants loved the Japenese, Dominican, and the Steak house. All of us hated the seafood CAPRI. yuck.. Maybe since i come from the New England area and know what lobster really taste like i hated it and it smelled fishy as soon as we walked in. We had about 6 kids with us and they had sooo much fun. We had always fully stocked water & presidente beer in our fridge. Our room was always perfectly clean. Did we tip? Of course we did we took $150 in american one dollar bills and they always appreicated a tip. I think they would of treated us well whether we tipped or not. We didn't even waste all the ones we took.
reviews.title: Beautiful Pool and Beaches

reviews.text: There were 9 of us in all from Dec 23rd - 30th - five 40 year olds, two 8 year olds, one 10 year old and one 13 year old. We've been to many all inclusives (Cancun, Puerto Rico, Aruba) and this resort was better than most. Some opionions/advice - 1) stay in the Royal Service area 2) Tip the towel boy the day before to get a cabana for the following day 3) Use the Royal Service to get restaurant resevations a day in advance 4) the food was better than most all inclusives (we only ate at the ala carte restaurants and enjoyed the Chinese, Japanese, Italian, and Mexican) 5) beach was ok but water was murky and a little cold 6) Gabi Club was good for breakfast and lunch 7) a few dollars do go a long way 8) casino was a little lame because they have no craps 9) there is not much to do at the resort but if you just want to chill and relax, it's the place to be 10) it was not that crowded for a holiday week 11) two people in our group did get sick for a day or 2 and they said that they would still go back - you can get sick on any island, anywhere 12) the rest of us would definitely go back again 13) you get what you pay for - we paid DOUBLE the price in Dec 2005 to go to Aruba and this was a better value for the money!

reviews.text: We just returned from a six day stay at the Melia Caribe Tropical. Being referred by a friend who went in Nov. 2005, we took their advice and went with the Royal Service - it was well worth it. However, we misread the desciption of the Delixe Suite, thinking that it had a jacuzzi for our 8 yr. old son (who loves jacuzzis), so when we got there, we upgraded to a one-bedroom suite (they had no master suites available). The initial impression of the room was that it smelled strongly of bug spray and mildew. I assumed that the bug spray was due to the fact that the room was just cleaned and that the mildew smell was from, perhaps, the lack of use of the room for a while. However, even after opening the sliding doors and turning on the fans, we never really did get rid of the mildew smell. However, the room was beautiful (our patio faced the Gabi restaurant) and the maid and butler service to the room were excellent.

reviews.text: We went for a wedding with a large group of family and friends. We have 3 young children, and they had a wonderful time. We stayed in a family suite, which was right by the beach and the pool. It was also right by a buffet restaurant for breakfast and lunch. The location was perfect, and the kids pool was just the right size. There is a shallow, round kids pool and an absolutely huge regular pool with a swim up bar and a number of shallow areas at the edges, including a zero entry area. The food at the buffets was great, and the buffet by our room overlooked the ocean, which was a beautiful setting. We had no trouble getting dinner reservations by calling ourselves, even the same day, if you were flexible with eating times. The train ran often, and the kids loved it. Really only needed it for dinners. We also walked from the beach area to the lobby/restaurant area, and it was not a bad walk. The kids played in the play area of the kids club, but mostly wanted to be at the beach or pools. The activity programs looked fun but we didn't use them.
reviews.title: Dream Vacation

reviews.text: Check in took 15 min and was very easy. No one asked up to upgrade, and we were never approached about a time share.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: Didn't want to leave and I would definitely go back!
reviews.title: Dont go its not worth it

reviews.text: We are seasoned vacationers, this was our 4th time to DR and our parents 10th time. For the money we paid we were very disappointed. Our rooms wern't ready on time, my kids found a condom and cigaret buts under the bed, our TV had a red spot on it and the beds were curved in the middle! That was just our room, my parents room that was on the bottom floor was infested with ants and they saw a cockroach the last day of stay! This was Villa 28! We like to pay for good service...at this resort you have to pay to get service...on top of the enormous fee we paid to stay here...if they did not see you with money in hand you were not getting served for a while!! We liked to tip Alfredo who made our omletes in the morning... he was nice and didn't expect to get tipped!!! The place was too big for my kids and handicapped father, we kept track one day of how much time we spent on the train that took you where we wanted to go....it ended up being 2 hrs. and 9 min. One positive thing was the grounds were beautiful! I really wanted this vacation to be the best due to an accident my husband had back in August that left him with a fractured skull one day before we were to take a planned trip so my kids were really looking forward to this one!!!! Thanks Melia for this disappointment!!! We were talking to others at the resort who are seasoned vacationers and they shared the same experiences.... This hotel would be good for those who don't know what they should be getting for a 5 star!!
reviews.title: Great resort, will go again

reviews.text: Not worth it they gave us hell room was dirty smelled like mold shower had lo presure to change room took us all day on the sunniest day no one cares u get ignored pool was dirty imposible to make reservations at restaurants had to take a train to go everywhere took 30 mins from room to lobby to eat drinks were terrible very slo service im telling u dont go u will regret it more of a frustration then a vacation

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a fantastic stay at Melia. We exchanged a timeshare for a week in June and had a beautiful one-bedroom unit, full kitchen, jacuzzi and washer in the Royal Service area. We chose the all-inclusive package and so glad we did. EVERYONE is friendly, helpful, can't do enough for you. They made us feel very welcome and even encouraged our feeble attempts to communicate in Spanish. The food was great, we enjoyed The Capri restaurant but the open-air Gabi restaurant was our favorite- great atmophere and service. The grounds are like a beautiful preserve. It is a large resort but I walked the perimeter in a 1/2 hour each a.m. For those who enjoy the ride, there are golf carts, trains and horse drawn carriages. The pools are like lagoons and very clean. The landscaping just has to be seen! Beautiful! Security is out and about - 24 hours. The resort is only 20 min. from the airport, as well. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to return. I highly recommend this resort.

reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Melia Caribe Tropical for our first time. We spent 8 days there are were very impressed with the resort. We would suggest calling very early in the morning for your reservations to make sure you can get in. We also took one day an booked a Monster Truck tour. This is a must if you want to see the country and the way fo life in the Domican. The trip was from 8am til 5p.m. but worth every penny. This was my first trip out of the United States and everything was run just as I would have wanted it to go. All of our flights were on time and even tough we had to wait minutes in line it just showed us how security was really working. Greatful for that.
